meaning: To reduce in amount, degree, or intensity
example: The intensity of the waves abated in Kanyakumari, leading to safer conditions for the fishermen to return to the shore.

example: Esakki behaved aberrantly when he was asked to dance like Madonna.

meaning: To encourage or help someone to do something wrong
example: Antony was accused of abetting the thief in the robbery.
Ari abhors dishonesty and avoids people who lie.
Covai Sathasivam finds cruelty to animals absolutely abhorrent.
Mr. Bean cannot abide the cacophony coming from the construction site.

meaning: Highly skilled or proficient at something
example: I am adept at writing Tamil poems, while Esakki is adept at lying.

meaning: Involving a lot of effort; very difficult and tiring
example: ItтАЩs arduous to win in the race of technology.
The abject behavior of the corrupt politician is disgusting.

meaning: To formally reject or renounce something (often a belief)
example: Some people have abjured the belief that placing a peacock feather in a book will cause it to produce offspring.
